title: 409A Deferred Compensation Plan
html:
Home » Services » Retirement » 409A Deferred Compensation Plan

Beyond the

limits.

Boundary-free future.

Where standard retirement plan contributions max out, a 409A Deferred Compensation Plan steps in. Exclusively for ministers and qualified church organizations, it allows participants to defer additional income and reduce current taxes.

Find my consultant
409A considerations
Maxed-out

The participant wants to contribute above the maximum limitation of the AG 403(b) plan.

Lost time

The participant has several years’ worth of contributions from an employer who has not been contributing regularly, and/or the employer wants to send a lump sum plus monthly contributions.

Gift deposit

The contribution is a lump-sum deposit given to the minister as a retirement gift.

A well-drafted Deferred Compensation Plan can allow for deferment of all taxable compensation until distribution. The money still legally belongs to the employer, but it can be set aside and invested for growth in the 409A.

Is a 409A right for you?
Let’s walk through it together.

Thank you!

Your submission has been received. We’ll be in touch shortly.

409A deserves love too.

The ugly stepchild of retirement. Just ask Kyle.
